job.position: Technical Recruiter
job.description:
Job Description

Are you looking for a service/sales career with unlimited income potential

For an opportunity to leverage your previous IT Recruitment success and be a creative solution finder for top companies in the marketplace, read on...?

Roth Staffing has appeared on the Inc. 500 list three times and continues to be recognized as an industry leader through our four full-service staffing divisions, Ultimate Staffing Services, Ledgent, Ledgent Technology and Adams & Martin Group ? and all of our growth has been organic and without venture capital funding.?

By honoring our company with this prestigious opportunity, Inc. Magazine also recognizes the fact that ?Roth only hires the most talented people and is unwilling to compromise from being the very best".?

Are you that person?

The Technical Recruiter aspect of this role requires a proven track record in recruiting, multi-tasking, computer skills, excellent written and verbal communication skills and effective time management. ?The function of this role is to identify qualified staffing associates to fill a variety of specialty positions through effective recruiting, interviewing and screening processes, and ensuring successful placements of temporary, temporary-to-hire and full-time candidates.?

This individual will develop relationships by securing thorough job order requirements, matching qualified candidates to positions, monitoring job performance and Ambassador satisfaction. The position requires a consultative mindset, ability to juggle multiple priorities and the ability to grow & expand client relationships to better position Roth Staffing for repeat business.

Role Requirements:

Minimum two years recruitment experience, in the IT niche
A Bachelors Degree?
Strong negotiation and persuasion skills
Self-motivated and able to work independently in a fast paced environment
Effective oral and written communication skills
Ability to interact with all levels of management
Account management background preferred
?

We are an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status or any other protected characteristic.

Job ID: TRSACLEDTECH

AC2019

job.position: Technical Recruiter
job.description:
Are you motivated to excel and able to influence, while building strong relationships? Do you have the ability to attract potential candidates through advanced marketing and branding, as well as social media tools? Have you mastered the art of sourcing and networking to identify and recruit outstanding talent? If you are saying yes, then Experis has an outstanding opportunity for you to work with our team as a Technical Recruiter!
As a Technical Recruiter with Experis, you will deliver superb customer service to customers and consultants by matching top talent to exciting opportunities with our customers. You will play a critical role in partnering with our customers to source, screen and match candidates for their temporary and permanent employee needs.
Experis is the global leader in professional resourcing and project-based workforce solutions. We accelerate organizations' growth by intensely attracting, assessing, and placing specialized expertise in Engineering, IT and Finance.
Main functions:
* Manages the requirement fulfillment process from receiving to facilitating placement of the candidate on a professional assignment.
* Qualifies job orders to understand client needs and requirements.
* Uses a variety of sourcing tools and techniques (job boards, internal database, LinkedIn, Boolean, referrals) to connect with top talent in the local market territory.
* Interviews candidates to evaluate their technical qualifications for assignments.
* Communicates effectively with client hiring managers.
* Conducts candidate reference checks. Uses candidate reference checks to develop additional business opportunities.
* Troubleshoots to resolve problems or complaints of customers and contract employees.
* Builds professional relationships with candidates, customers, contract employees, and staff.
* Bachelor's degree or equivalency of education and work experience
* 1-3 years prior work experience in technical recruiting is required
* Ability to communicate effectively with others.
* Ability to advise, counsel, guide, and negotiate with others
* Ability to develop the professional skills of employees through teaching, training, etc.
* Ability to effectively and tactfully address concerns.
ManpowerGroup is an EOE/AA/Vets/Disabled Employer

AC2019

job.position: Technical PM (Scada)
job.description:
Job Description

Technical Project Manager

Position Summary

This position can sit in MN or Denver.? They can also relocate from anywhere in the country.? They would need to work Monday through Thursday most weeks and fly back home Thursday night.? There will be flexibility in work from home as well.

Interview - Phone and then MUST interview in person.

The Technical Project Manager leads and guides technical resources to accomplish project objectives.
Summary of Responsibilities
Leads design workshops, assessments, and planning sessions. Reviews and approves technical designs.
Collaborates with technical resources to accomplish? hardware installation, environment setup, production certification, software deployment, integration development, testing, deployment, data management, and vendor technical activities.
Serves as technical liaison to other teams involved in project
Provides technical insights on business area specific technology. Assures there is traceability from requirements to design to as-built solution.
Works closely with IT Security to ensure adherence to security standards
Facilitates communications across teams / SMEs
Performs issue identification and resolution
Point of contact with leadership to represent technical status, issues /options for resolution, and risks/mitigations
Ensures adherence to software lifecycle management processes for technical processes and artifacts.

Skill Set Requirements

Minimum three years of technical project management experience, with documented experience managing a custom software development project with a $5M project budget or greater.
Proven experience with the custom software development lifecycle including managing non-functional requirements specification, design activities, prototype development, testing, and final deployment.
Proven vendor management experience including aggressively driving vendor to meet date and budget commitments.
Proven experience on a project with a large number of impacted users, (i.e., at least 200 users) and managing the associated change management.

Our client is currently seeking a Technical Project Manager to work on-site in Mountain View, CA.

For immediate consideration please email resumes/applications to? [Click Here to Email Your Resum?] ?or call ?


This job will have the following responsibilities:?
  • The work you do will help maintain a line of business with existing partners, assist in the launch of product in new markets and lead the charge on resolving issues within countries they have already launched.
  • Product finance related issue handling: Product integration partners are expected to send? daily transaction reports, weekly invoices, and other special reports for each day, week, and country/currency within agreed time frame.?

AC2019

job.position: Technical Project Manager III
job.description:
Job Description

Our client is currently seeking a Technical Project Manager III

In this role, you will be responsible for designing and implementing data management strategies for clients of the Regulatory Affairs business. You will function as a business and data analyst for all data associated projects and work with project teams to ensure proper assessment, design, and implementation of Regulatory Information Management (RIM) and document management (EDM) strategies. Your role will function as a source of both technical and domain expertise and bring value through disciplined project execution. You will be expected to be focused on the RIM systems and processes used by Regulatory Affairs and understand the issues with the management of data and documents between systems.

Responsibilities
?Work with Project Manager, team, and Business Leaders to assess, design, and execute RIM system implementation, configuration and migration projects
?Develop and confirm business rules for data mapping, data management, and data migration
?Design and implement data management protocols
?Identify and mitigate project risks

Minimum qualifications
?7+ years working in Data Analysis or a related field
?Strong communication and presentation skills?
?Familiarity with IDMP, xEVMPD, and other Regulatory data standards
?Knowledge of RIM software vendors and products (e.g. ARIS Register, PAREXEL Insight Manager, Veeva Vault)?
?Experience with computer systems validation.?
?Experience with data migrations?
?BS degree in science, engineering or related field?

Preferred qualifications?
?Strong communication skills (verbal and written)
?Familiarity with eCTD structure and regulatory submissions types
?Familiarity with regulatory data models (RIM)
?MBA or advanced degree in science, engineering or related field

job.position: Technical Program Manager
job.description:
Job Description

Please apply here or send your resume to or apply here to be considered!DescriptionA Technical Account Manager is responsible for Customer satisfaction, and overall technical support as it relates to Managed Services Customers. Further responsibilities include, managing diverse groups of people across multiple technical disciplines including systems, network, storage and backup, and being a the primary customer interface for support, project work and service level adherence. The Technical Account Manager is required to provide technical leadership for the technical support team members along with leading design, architecture, and project definition discussions.The Technical Account Manager will help assign day to day workload and priority for the team supporting the environment. The TAM will monitor SLA levels and Support activities occurring throughout the day and week. The TAM will help technical resources escalate issues and support cases to help drive resolution for the clients. Reporting of Service Level adherence is required on a weekly and monthly basis.The Manager?s role is considered an escalation path for urgent customer and internal issues and will often require a Manager to handle difficult relationship impacting conversations. Ultimately a Technical Account Manager is responsible for the operational health of the Customer(s) relationship. Mentors and/or guides employees to grow in their position, and prepare for new challenges Monitors and manages key operational metrics and SLA?s to insure operational health Proactively researches, analyzes trends and using that knowledge to increase the value proposition to the customer Reviews existing instructions, guidelines, standards and policies seeking continuous improvement Assists in developing instructions, guidelines, standards and /or policies Manages resolution on work orders escalated through the IT Support Process Develops and publishes monthly production statistics, as directed, to report on system operational performance Relies on experience and judgment to plan and accomplish all work tasks and has a certain degree of creativity and latitude Works within a team and fosters a team attitude focused on exceptional customer service, high levels of accomplishment and a process driven organizationRequirementsTechnical Knowledge: Understanding Network, Systems and Storage terminology and concepts required Technical vendor interface experience a plus Industry knowledge in emerging technology and trends required Problem resolution and conflict management skills required Knowledge and understanding of compliance requirements for HIPAA/HITECH, SOC, PCI, NIST

job.position: Technical Program Manager
job.description:
Job Description

Overview

As a member of the corporate team, you?ll focus on enhancing the relationship with our clients as we provide outstanding business solution services. Within departments like Accounting & Finance, Human Resources, and Engineering, Conduent is actively staffing all teams with roles like Recovery Analyst, Client Services Specialist, and Senior Management Consultant. At Conduent, we give our employees the opportunity to further develop their career skills with the intention of growing them into leaders within the organization.
  • Full Time
  • Experienced
  • Professional Development Opportunities
Success Profile

What will make you successful at Conduent?
Check out the traits we?re looking for and see if you have the right mix.
  • Adaptable 9
  • Detail-Oriented 9
  • Multi-Tasker 8
  • Strategic 10
  • Expressive Presenter 6
  • Conceptual 4
Traits are on a scale of 1 to 10

Addtional Traits
  • Insightful
  • Organized
  • Consistent
  • Efficient
  • Focused
  • Logical
  • Responsible
  • Versatile
Rewards
  • Healthcare
    • Conduent is proud to offer comprehensive and competitive benefits that reflect the value of our employees. Benefits will differ by country, please contact your recruiter for details specific to your location.
  • Balance
    • Maintaining a work/life balance is the key to success.
  • Collaboration
    • Department learning opportunities and company-wide digital knowledge share.
  • Compensation
    • Competitive salaries.
  • Family Support
    • Additional resources to support employees with families.
  • Professional Development
    • Conduent offers programs to help advance the careers of our employees.
Responsibilities

Description
Conduent is the world's largest provider of diversified business process services with leading capabilities in transaction processing, automation, analytics and constituent experience. We work with both government and commercial customers in assisting them to deliver quality services to the people they serve.

We manage interactions with patients and the insured for a significant portion of the U.S. healthcare industry. We are the customer interface for large segments of the technology industry and the operational and processing partner of choice for public transportation systems around the world.

Whether it's digital payments, claims processing, benefit administration, automated tolling, customer care or distributed learning - Conduent manages and modernizes these interactions to create value for both our clients and their constituents. Learn more at .

Job Title: Technical Program Manager

Skills Required:
v? Minimum 15 years? experience working on project(s) involving the implementation of software development life cycle(s) (SDLC).
v? Must have solid experience in writing? SQL statements for data validations
v? Ability to design, develop, test and debug tests cases/scripts/plans/strategy documents?
v? 5 Years of experience in healthcare with? ANSI 5010 X12 Transaction Sets knowledge is a must
v? Proficiency with writing Proof of concepts
v? Experience using automation tools and apply CICD process
v? Experience working with Java-based RESTful, Webservice APIs
v? Knowledgeable in reading app diagrams and user flowcharts
v? Collaborate effectively with all cross-functional teams and raise questions/clarifications on any vague requirements or functionality
v? Provide support during UAT phase and Live deployment - executing smoke tests and validating/reproducing reported issues
v? 5+ years of deep (really deep) .NET development (C#) development experience including cross platform communication technologies such as Web API or WCF
v? 5+ years of database design, SQL programming and performance tuning experience
v? Must have Azure and Amazon AWS would be an asset
v? Must have database and SQL coding experience such as MS SQL Server, Oracle, MySQL
v? Must have deep knowledge on IaaS, PaaS, SaaS

Education/Qualification and Certifications:
v? This position requires a Master's degree? in Computer Applications and? 15 years of work experience in related field
v? Minimum 5 years in IT Technical architectural experience in health care industry
v? Excellent communication skills, attention to detail, and ability to communicate to all levels of the organization
v? Service-oriented self-starter who takes initiative

Job Roles and Responsibilities
v? Directs the activities of software applications development
v? Manages the development, installation, and maintenance of computer programs for business ?applications
v? Directs and coordinates activities related to the design, development and implementation of software operating systems
v? Plans, conducts, and coordinates business programming applications activities
v? Establishes programming standards and program documentation requirements
v? Reviews current status of system applications and prepares recommendations for improvements
v? Manages the development and implementation of web applications?
Manages the technical programming and database development related to the organization?s website

Conduent is an Equal Opportunity Employer and considers applicants for all positions without regard to race, color, creed, religion, ancestry, national origin, age, gender identity, gender expression, sex/gender, marital status, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, medical condition, use of a guide dog or service animal, military/veteran status, citizenship status, basis of genetic information, or any other group protected by law. People with disabilities who need a reasonable accommodation to apply for or compete for employment with Conduent may request such accommodation(s) by clicking on the following link, completing the accommodation request form, and submitting the request by using the 'Submit' button at the bottom of the form. For those using Google Chrome or Mozilla Firefox please download the form first: click here to access or download the form .

Whether it's digital payments, claims processing, benefit administration, automated tolling, customer care or distributed learning - Conduent manages and modernizes these interactions to create value for both our clients and their constituents. Learn more at .

Job Overview
We are looking for aTechnicalProgram Manager whowill be part of Conduent Technology Services organization and will lead our program management efforts within each of the businesses under CTS.?The ideal candidate will?be an outstanding manager who can leverage their thought leadership and project management competency to help lead and manage the portfolio. The successful candidate must have exceptional problem solving skills, strong business judgment, and demonstrated experience managing cross-functional teams. This role requires excellent technical acumen and internal/external client facing tact!

This role will be responsible for the following responsibilities:

Responsibilities:
  • Drive Conduent?s technology platforms, solutions and execution.
  • Organizing programs and activities in alignment with organization mission and goals.
  • Develop new programs to support the strategic direction of the organization.
  • Create and managing long-term goals.
  • Developing a budget and operating plan for the program.
  • Developing an evaluation method to assess program strengths and identify areas for improvement.
  • Ensuring goals are met in areas including customer satisfaction, safety, quality and team member performance.
  • Producting accurate and timely reporting of program status throughout its life cycle.
  • Work closely with various Conduent business groups and clients to understand the problems, improve collaboration and seek opportunities to drive technology platforms and solutions in relevant areas of business
  • Establishes and assures adherence to budget, schedules, work plans, and performance requirements.
  • Regularly interacts with senior management or executive levels both within Conduent as well as on client side.
?
Support includes project and operations planning, control, reporting, risk management, personnel management, and implementation support. Key skill sets include:

Requirements:
  • The ideal candidate will at least have a Bachelor's degree in a technical field (e.g. Computer Science, Engineering). Masters degree is highly desired.
  • Minimum 10 years of industry experience in product development from market strategy through ideation, prototyping to product launch including at least of 6?years of technology management experience.
  • The ability to lead software-centric projects leveraging SharePoint, MS Project, O365, and other Microsoft technologies for a varied user base.
  • Deep knowledge and experience with distributed systems design and development.
  • Understanding industry trends and future state technologies and their applicability to different areas of business
  • Proven track record of strong verbal/written communication & system solutioning skills, including an ability to effectively communicate with both business and technical teams across the world
  • Affinity for science and the scientific discovery process
  • Good technical comprehension and excellent communication skills. Experience communicating with highly technical requirements, and translating highly technical topics to business teams.?
  • Experience with design thinking, innovation lifecycle of software development (prototyping, ethnography, fail early etc.).
  • Experience coordinating activities across multiple infrastructure, data, security, and policy support organizations and stakeholders while managing distributed team resources
  • Exceptional written and verbal communication skills, familiarity/experience with leading Agile Scrum and Waterfall projects, and a demonstrated team player style/approach. Project manager must understand implementations and protections of PII, code modernization and transformation, and developing and executing ?as-is? architectures into ?to-be? architectures. Minimum eight years Project Management experience.
?
Agile Scrum support may include organizing and facilitating scrum meetings; developing and managing project plans, roadmaps and backlogs; communication, escalation, and monitoring; and product owner & stakeholder coordination; and reporting velocity, status, etc. according to defined reporting parameters.
  • The selected candidate may be required to provide support outside of normal business hours (nights, weekends, early mornings, etc.) to support technical deployments requiring support during non-standard hours. These hours will be addressed as needed on a case-by-case basis.
  • Experience, desire and comfort to build and work with teams located across many locations.
AdditionalRequirements

?
Experience with other tools such as SalesForce, AINS eCASE, Cerenade, and proprietary CBP/WCR/BEMSD applications is desired but not required.

?

Ability to quickly learn new technology domains and interact in a rich way with the research and engineering communities in addition to lines of business.

?

Strong oral communication skills including ability to make presentations and prospect with clients

?

Strong analytical skills, computer skills and excellent organizational skills

?

Ability to work independently as well as on a team with limited supervision

?

Excellent collaboration and negotiation skills

?

Ability to travel (25%) may be required

?

Proven program management skill set

?

Results driven with a positive attitude?

Addtional Traits
  • Insightful
  • Organized
  • Consistent
  • Efficient
  • Focused
  • Logical
  • Responsible
  • Versatile
Rewards
  • Healthcare
    • Conduent is proud to offer comprehensive and competitive benefits that reflect the value of our employees. Benefits will differ by country, please contact your recruiter for details specific to your location.
  • Balance
    • Maintaining a work/life balance is the key to success.
  • Collaboration
    • Department learning opportunities and company-wide digital knowledge share.
  • Compensation
    • Competitive salaries.
  • Family Support
    • Additional resources to support employees with families.
  • Professional Development
    • Conduent offers programs to help advance the careers of our employees.
Responsibilities

Description

Conduent is the world's largest provider of diversified business process services with leading capabilities in transaction processing, automation, analytics and constituent experience. We work with both government and commercial customers in assisting them to deliver quality services to the people they serve.?

We manage interactions with patients and the insured for a significant portion of the U.S. healthcare industry. We are the customer interface for large segments of the technology industry and the operational and processing partner of choice for public transportation systems around the world.?

Whether it's digital payments, claims processing, benefit administration, automated tolling, customer care or distributed learning - Conduent manages and modernizes these interactions to create value for both our clients and their constituents. Learn more at? .

Job description
The Technical Program Manager (TPM) is the primary operational owner of Conduent?s line of eligibility and enrollment broker products. The position requires day-to-day interaction with existing business operations as well as our sales and solutions groups.This includes defining market requirements, product requirement documents and packaging the features into product releases. The TPM works closely with key customers, product architects and development, marketing, sales, and support to develop and manage new product releases and upgrades to customers.
The TPM maintains the product road map, creates concept documents, business and use cases for new services, features and functions to support customer demands, growth strategies and profitability targets.

Key responsibilities

?

Serve as primary product expert and evangelist.

?

Lead product design, development, release process for assigned products and maintain the product development road map.Work with the engineering team to roll out features in an agile, continuous deployment environment.

?

Collaborate with design, engineering, and business leads on product flows and aesthetics

?

Manage UX testing and optimization solutions

?

Coordinate the collection, description, analysis and prioritization of requests for new product functionality from customers and prospects

?

Create detailed use cases, business requirements, and analytical documents

?

Develop hands-on, in-depth knowledge of competitive products and maintain technical analysis of competitive strengths and weaknesses

?

Coordinate beta testing of new products and features. Document and report problems and recommend solutions/improvements to program managers. Participate in product performance bench-marking activities.

?

Ownership of features and/or products

?

Drive product strategy forward

Qualifications

?

Should have 8+ years of total IT experience with 3-7 years of product management experience for an enterprise software or network management company, consumer facing preferred

?

Strategic problem-solving skills and data-driven decision-making abilities?with excellent verbal and written communication skills

?

Ability to effectively interface with stakeholders

?

Consistent track record of making great decisions after weighing all the factors that must be considered (experience, brand, business impact, technical impact, etc.)

?

Must have experience with cross-functional teams that include operations and technical staff

?

Must be able to effectively interact and communicate with executive management

?

Ability to analyze user data and extract business requirements from multiple stakeholders and transform them into usable and elegant product specifications

?

Deep empathetic understanding of user experience and user research

?

Knowledge and passion for education, online experiences and brand growth

?

Excited to work with a small interdisciplinary team in a fast-paced environment

?

Bachelor's degree (degrees in engineering / CS is a major plus)

?

BA/BS (degree in technical field preferred)

job.position: Technical Director, IT Security Operations
job.description:
Overview

Every day at Perspecta, we enable hundreds of thousands of people to take on our nations most important work. Were a company founded on a diverse set of capabilities and skills, bound together by a single promise: we never stop solving our nations most complex challenges. Our team of engineers, analysts, developers, investigators, integrators and architects work tirelessly to create innovative solutions. We continually push ourselvesto respond, to adapt, to go further. To look ahead to the changing landscape and develop new and innovative ways to serve our customers.

Perspecta works with U.S. government customers in defense, intelligence, civilian, health care, and state and local markets. Our high-caliber employees are rewarded in many waysnot only through competitive salaries and benefits packages, but the opportunity to create a meaningful impact in jobs and on projects that matter.

Perspectas talented and robust workforce14,000 strongstands ready to welcome you to the team. Lets make an impact together.

Perspecta is an AA/EEO Employer - Minorities/Women/Veterans/Disabled and other protected categories

Responsibilities

The Technical Director, IT Security Operations reports directly to the CISO and is responsible for Technical Security Operations to include: Security Operations Center (SOC), Focused Operations (forensics, malware analysis, intel threat, insider threat tools), and Security Architecture and Engineering. This position has the responsibility of managing all of Security Operations for a Defense Contractor and should be familiar working with the DIB (Defense Industrial Base) as well as with DFARS (NIST) requirements.

  • NOTE: This is a hands-on, technically active role. Your technical skills will be applied daily to all aspects of this job.
  • Responsible for synergizing security operations, tools, and processes for a newly merged company.
  • Making technical and policy decisions that affect corporate security posture, especially as it relates to DFARS (NIST SP 800-171 compliance).
  • Understanding placement of network/security infrastructure and visibility requirements for hosts, infrastructure, and network devices.
  • Working with the Defense Industrial Base (DIB)
  • Providing monthly or as needed reports to the CISO
  • Working collaboratively with other teams in the CISO organization as well as within the CIO to impact change and define an acceptable security posture
  • Managing cyber incidents as they occur

Management and oversight of:

  • Security Operations Center (SOC) Tier 1-III SOC analysis and response; monitoring/triaging events and analyzing/working incidents.
  • Focused Operations (to include Malware analysis, Forensics, Insider Threat, intel threat investigation).
  • Security Engineering: Deciding on, implementing, and monitoring/managing security tools within the enterprise; security architects designing the solutions.

Qualifications

  • Requires BA/BS with a minimum of 16 years experience. At least 5 years as a manager; and 15 years in Cybersecurity with experience supporting government customer/s or contractor/s.
  • Secret clearance required

Must have specialized knowledge and ACTIVE, HANDS-ON experience in one or more of the following;

  • Experience managing a SOC required
  • High level understanding of the multitude of tools required to be managed and implemented by a Security Operations team
  • SIEM tools and log/IDS management
  • NIST cybersecurity controls and frameworks
  • Running tools in and supporting on-prem, Cloud, and hybrid environments
  • Creating and reviewing corporate-wide policies and rule

Desired Skills:

  • Past experience with system or network administration desired
  • CISSP certification

#LI

#CJ

*LI

Options

job.position: Technical Customer Service
job.description:
Job Description

The Technical Customer Service Representative will be responsible for daily contact with customers and focused on problem resolution. You will be receiving and responding to customers Technical questions by phone, email, fax and live web chat. Expect 50+ calls on a VERY busy day. These are long and technical conversations with technicians, fitness store managers and/or consumer owners.

The end result from these conversations with customers will be to process service warranty and spare parts orders. This will require a great deal of accuracy and detailed data entry. The customers calling will be consumers, dealers, third party service providers and commercial or retail customers.

Typical call from technician at Lifetime Fitness:
"I have your product and the mechanism on the right foot slot is slipping. We are missing a bolt. Can you help me?"
Work Environment
This is the corporate HQ for Engineering, Design, Warranty and IT. The customer service group is a team of 6.

There is an area for the all team members to use the fitness machines for working out, at any time.

The dress is business casual and their culture represents high class service in the health and wellness industry.

This is a 1st shift position, Monday through Friday.
Qualifications
HS Diploma
3 years or more of experience in a call center environment

Preferred work experience supporting mechanical products in warranty or troubleshooting issues or dispatching service

About Aerotek:
We know that a company's success starts with its employees. We also know that an individual's success starts with the right career opportunity. As a Best of Staffing ? Client and Talent leader, Aerotek's people-focused approach yields competitive advantage for our clients and rewarding careers for our contract employees. Since 1983, Aerotek has grown to become a leader in recruiting and staffing services. With more than 250 non-franchised offices, Aerotek's 8,000 internal employees serve more than 300,000 contract employees and 18,000 clients every year. Aerotek is an Allegis Group company, the global leader in talent solutions. Learn more at Aerotek.com.

job.position: Technical Claims Specialist
job.description:
Summary/Objective

The Technical Specialist will:
  • Investigate and evaluate coverage, liability, and damages on assigned claims, determine appropriate reserves and settlement values, and resolve claims on merits. Claims inventory complexity will range from complex high exposure claims and files in litigation.
  • Direct defense counsel on litigated files, as well as attend mediations and trials, as necessary.
  • Work independently with minimal direct supervision and resolve claims within designated monetary authority.
  • Present claims, if required, to senior management at quarterly Claims Advisory meeting and update these spreadsheets when needed. Prepare appropriate reinsurance reports and timely updates.
  • Participate in claim audits and other special projects as assigned. The Technical Specialist will have both commercial and personal lines expertise.
The ideal candidate for this position will have litigation experience in both personal and commercial lines handling diverse exposures in property and casualty.

Essential Functions
  • Investigate and evaluate coverage, liability and damages on assigned claims and determine appropriate reserves and settlement value in accordance with standard practice guidelines including quality, cycle time and insured contact. Direct defense counsel toward most appropriate resolution. Manage legal expenses and other expenses.
  • Deliver exceptional customer service through professional communication including telephone, email and written correspondence.
  • Maintain a high level of technical expertise specific in the areas handled. Provide mentoring to claim representatives as needed.
  • Attend mediation and trials as required.
  • Prepare written reports on a timely basis for Claims Advisory and Reinsurance.
Travel
  • Between 10-20% travel is expected for attending mediations and trials when needed.
Required Education and Experience
  • A 620 license is required. A BA/BS is required or industry designation equivalent such as AIC, CPCU etc Minimum 3-5 years Homeowners and Commercial claim handling experience .
Preferred Education and Experience
  • A BA/BS is preferred. Minimum of 5 years of experience for a Technical Specialist. Other industry designations, AIC, CPCU, Claims Law
The preceding position description has been designed to indicate the general nature of the work performed; the level of knowledge and skills typically required; and usual working conditions of this position. It is not designed to contain, or be interpreted as a comprehensive, complete or exclusive list of the duties of the position. Additional and different duties may be assigned from time to time.

job.position: Technical and Applications Management Specialist IV
job.description:
Job Title: Technical and Applications Management Specialist IV

Location: Norfolk, VA

Job Duties:

ADP Technology Services, Inc. seeks a Technical and Applications Management Specialist IV at our Norfolk, VA location. Responsibilities: Provision network-attached storage (NAS), including file share creation, quota expansion, export access, user access, Access Control List (ACL), multiprotocol user mapping, user home drive, and File Transfer Protocol (FTP) shares. Provision storage area network (SAN), including storage device selection/creation, zoning, and Logical Unit Number (LUN) masking. Conduct and document network storage operations processes. Work with ADP project and infrastructure groups to operate and support storage and host environments. Participate in case review calls with vendors and assist with scheduling and implementing software code upgrades. Perform solutions design, capacity management, storage migration and code upgrades of storage arrays.

Education and Qualifications/Skills and Competencies:

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering or a related field plus eight (8) years of experience in a related occupation.

Work Experience:

Three (3) years of experience must include: NetApp NAS, NetApp Clustered OnTap, NetApp 7 mode, and NetApp 7MTT; CIFS and NFS; Snapshots, snapmirror, and snapvault; OnCommand System Manager, OnCommand Operations/Performance Manager, DFM, OnCommand Unified Manager or OnCommand Insight; Bash shell, PowerShell or WFA; EMC Isilon storage; NTFS and batch scripting; NDMP using NetBackup or Commvault simpana; UNIX, Linux, or Windows Server operating systems; and VMAX 3/VMAX All-Flash and Python scripting.

We're designing a better way to work, so you can achieve what you're working for. Consistently named one of the 'Most Admired Companies' by FORTUNE Magazine, and recognized by DiversityInc as one of the 'Top 50 Companies for Diversity,' ADP works with more than 740,000 organizations across the globe to help their people work smarter, embrace new challenges, and unleash their talent. "Always Designing for People" means we're creating platforms that will transform how great work gets done, so together we can unlock a world of opportunity.

At ADP, we believe that diversity fuels innovation. ADP is committed to equal employment opportunities regardless of race, color, genetic information, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, lawful alien status, national origin, age, marital status, or protected veteran status. We support an inclusive workplace where associates excel based on personal merit, qualifications, experience, ability, and job performance.

job.description:
Job Title: Technical and Applications Management Specialist III

Location: Roseland, NJ

Job Duties:

ADP Technology Services, Inc. seeks a Technical and Applications Management Specialist III at our Roseland, NJ location. Responsibilities: Design and maintain storage environments for unstructured data that supports worldwide users and enterprise applications, including use of batch scripting to help with large data

transfers. Install, upgrade, and configure Storage Area Network (SAN) and Network-Attached Storage (NAS) Arrays/switches. Maintain architectural standards relating to the storage infrastructure, including SAN and NAS technologies, storage technologies, deduplication technologies, and data replication. Perform Disaster Recovery (DR) configuration and testing for large SAN and NAS environments. Perform day-to-day storage allocations, decommissions, health checks, and hardware maintenance. Install, configure, performance tune, and troubleshoot storage arrays. Participate in code and firmware upgrades of various

Fibre Channel (FC) switches and storage arrays.

Education and Qualifications/Skills and Competencies:

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering or a related field plus ten (10) years of related experience. One year of experience in the offered position or a related occupation will substitute for one year of education toward the bachelor's degree requirement.

Work Experience:

Three (3) years of experience must include: NetApp NAS; NetApp Clustered OnTap; CIFS and NFS and multiprotocol share allocation; NTFS; UNIX; Snapshots, Snapmirror, Snapvault, and NDMP solutions; 7MTT; EMC; NetApp products, including OnCommand System Manager, OnCommand Operations/Performance Manager, DFM, and OnCommand Unified Manager; and VMAX 3/VMAX All flash.

job.position: Technical Account Manager- Europe (French Speaker)
job.description:
POSITION OVERVIEW

Alarm.com, a rapidly growing, entrepreneurial technology company, is seeking a Strategic Technical Account Manager to join our International Team. This position suggests cooperation with a Business Development team in building relationships with strategic accounts in a given country (EMEA and APAC regions) while focusing on a technical aspect of such business relationship. Responsibilities will require client trainings, handling escalated technical issues, and new product evaluation and deployment in the region. The position is critical to ensuring that our partners understand and efficiently utilize the full suite of Alarm.com services ranging from backend integrations and support tools to end user features and functionality. The ideal candidate will be well versed in technology, have a keen problem solving sense, demonstrate strong communication skills, and have an interest in travel.

RESPONSIBILITIES

The Strategic Technical Account Managers primary job responsibilities will include:

  • Managing technical relationships with key accounts in the EMEA and APAC region under the guidance of the international business development team
  • Assisting with pre-sales engineering needs for key prospects and entry into new markets
  • Acting as a technical escalation point for potential issues in the region
  • Providing product introduction, installation, and support trainings to our business partners
  • Gathering feedback from partners and partner customers on how we can further localize our product offering for the market
  • Representing Alarm.com at various industry events along with the business development team
  • Staying up to date with new Alarm.com product release features in order to properly respond to partner inquiries
  • Collect feedback from key partners, Identifying product and feature improvements for local markets
  • Traveling across the region to engage with strategic dealer partners

REQUIREMENTS

  • BA or BS in an Engineering, Mathematics, or Sciences field is preferred but not mandatory
  • Language requirements must speak French at professional/native level, fluent in English
  • Electronic Security, CCTV, or IoT-related industry experience is a plus
  • 2+ years work experience in technical support and/or account management
  • The ability to communicate with customers and vendors, both in writing and verbally in a clear, professional manner
  • A highly motivated self-starter who is able to operate independently
  • Excellent people skills; natural customer service orientation and disposition candidate must enjoy working with clients and supporting internal customers in the organization
  • Excellent problem-solving skills
  • The ability and commitment to meet deadlines, even during high volume periods
  • Proficiency with Microsoft Outlook, Excel, Word, and PowerPoint
  • Ability to travel up to 75%

COMPANY INFO
Alarm.com, founded in 2000, is the industry leading technology provider of interactive security solutions. Through advanced wireless monitoring, mobile and web-based services, and a proven hosted services platform, Alarm.com helps protect over two million residential and commercial customers in over 28 countries across the world. Alarm.coms products and services are offered exclusively through a network of over 7,000 licensed and authorized Dealers. Alarm.coms headquarters are located in Vienna, Virginia, USA. For more information, visit www.alarm.com.

Alarm.com is an Equal Opportunity Employer

job.position: Teaching Assistant
job.description:
Job Description

Overview



The teacher assistant will be responsible for collaborating with teachers to monitor the development of each child.



Responsibilities



A general understanding of the teacher?s routine will be necessary when it comes to covering a classroom if the teacher is preoccupied. You will be required to work with all students in the building to promote their learning and pro-social development. In the event a student becomes a threat to themselves or others, it will be imperative that you provide support including the use of physical intervention techniques. You will assist with parent communication to keep them informed about their child?s development and any recent behavioral issues. Overall, general supervision within hallways, classrooms, cafeterias, and school yards will be the daily priority.



Qualifications

  • High School Diploma
  • College experience and or the completion of a bachelor?s degree preferred.
  • The ability to work and build relationships with students and families to help their school and behavioral progress.
  • A willingness to attend trainings and meetings to further your skill set.
#CB2

job.position: In-Home Teachers / Tutors, K-12, Any Subject
job.description:
SYLVAN IN-HOME TUTORING

We are looking for K-12 tutors to join our Sylvan In-Home Tutoring program! Experience
the difference and become part of our exclusive community of high-quality Sylvan In-
Home tutors.


Are you looking to get started as a private tutor or grow your existing tutoring business? If you
are a passionate, enthusiastic, skilled tutor who wants to work with K-12 students we have
families looking for Sylvan tutors NOW! We also have our proven and proprietary Sylvan
Method we are offering as an option to trained Sylvan In-Home tutors for the first time ever. Our
students who use this Method show 2-3x more academic growth than school alone, and we
want to help more kids by providing access to our tools through tutors like you. We want to help
more kids and make an impact.


Why should you become a Sylvan In-Home tutor?
Sylvan In-Home offers easy-to-use, online resources and teaching tools that make managing all
aspects of your tutoring business a cinch so that you can focus on what you love the
most.helping kids!
As a Sylvan In-Home tutor, youll get to:
- Access to our exclusive digital learning platform, hundreds of hours of content and
practice tests and our proven Sylvan Method (Kids in our centers show 2-3x more
growth in reading and math!)
- Establish your own rates and keep more of the income you earn because our
commissions are the lowest in the industry bar none
- Provide your students with 1:1 tutoring at mutually convenient locations such as their
home or a public library
- Create and maintain your online tutor profile and have your own unique profile url so you
can market yourself in other ways
- Set your own availability so that you can tutor when it works for you (and maintain it on
the website)
- Utilize the Sylvan In-Home website and mobile app to maintain your calendar/schedule,
receive payments directly into your bank account, accept/decline session requests and
communicate with your families
- And much more...


What do we look for in Sylvan In-Home tutors?
At Sylvan, we believe education is everything, great teachers matter, and that a childs future
depends on a solid education and a love of learning. Being a Sylvan tutor means youre part of
the legacy and 40- year reputation of being a trusted, recognized brand that has helped kids
succeed in over 600+ locations worldwide. Thats why we want the best and the brightest, first-
class tutors who share our passion. The ideal Sylvan In-Home candidate has the following
necessary qualifications:
- A Bachelors Degree (preferably one that relates to the type of tutoring youd like to offer)
- Although not required to apply, previous or current state teaching certification is a plus!
- Demonstrated background or experience in the subject you are tutoring
- Successful completion of a phone interview
- Successfully pass a background check

Start inspiring a love of learning and building confidence in students now. APPLY
TODAY.

the legacy and 40- year reputation of being a trusted, recognized brand that has helped kids

necessary qualifications:
- A Bachelors Degree (preferably one that relates to the type of tutoring youd like to offer)

- Demonstrated background or experience in the subject you are tutoring

- Successfully pass a background check

practice tests and our proven Sylvan Method (Kids in our centers show 2-3x more
growth in reading and math!)
- Establish your own rates and keep more of the income you earn because our
commissions are the lowest in the industry bar none
- Provide your students with 1:1 tutoring at mutually convenient locations such as their
home or a public library
- Create and maintain your online tutor profile and have your own unique profile url so you
can market yourself in other ways
- Set your own availability so that you can tutor when it works for you (and maintain it on
the website)
- Utilize the Sylvan In-Home website and mobile app to maintain your calendar/schedule,
receive payments directly into your bank account, accept/decline session requests and
communicate with your families
- And much more...


What do we look for in Sylvan In-Home tutors?
At Sylvan, we believe education is everything, great teachers matter, and that a childs future
depends on a solid education and a love of learning. Being a Sylvan tutor means youre part of
the legacy and 40- year reputation of being a trusted, recognized brand that has helped kids
succeed in over 600+ locations worldwide. Thats why we want the best and the brightest, first-
class tutors who share our passion. The ideal Sylvan In-Home candidate has the following
necessary qualifications:
- A Bachelors Degree (preferably one that relates to the type of tutoring youd like to offer)
- Although not required to apply, previous or current state teaching certification is a plus!
- Demonstrated background or experience in the subject you are tutoring
- Successful completion of a phone interview
- Successfully pass a background check

Start inspiring a love of learning and building confidence in students now. APPLY

Are you looking to get started as a private tutor or grow your existing tutoring business? If you
are a passionate, enthusiastic, skilled tutor who wants to work with K-12 students we have
families looking for Sylvan tutors NOW! We also have our proven and proprietary Sylvan
Method we are offering as an option to trained Sylvan In-Home tutors for the first time ever. Our
students who use this Method show 2-3x more academic growth than school alone, and we
want to help more kids by providing access to our tools through tutors like you. We want to help
more kids and make an impact.


Why should you become a Sylvan In-Home tutor?
Sylvan In-Home offers easy-to-use, online resources and teaching tools that make managing all
aspects of your tutoring business a cinch so that you can focus on what you love the
most.helping kids!
As a Sylvan In-Home tutor, youll get to:
- Access to our exclusive digital learning platform, hundreds of hours of content and
practice tests and our proven Sylvan Method (Kids in our centers show 2-3x more
growth in reading and math!)
- Establish your own rates and keep more of the income you earn because our
commissions are the lowest in the industry bar none
- Provide your students with 1:1 tutoring at mutually convenient locations such as their
home or a public library
- Create and maintain your online tutor profile and have your own unique profile url so you
can market yourself in other ways
- Set your own availability so that you can tutor when it works for you (and maintain it on
the website)
- Utilize the Sylvan In-Home website and mobile app to maintain your calendar/schedule,
receive payments directly into your bank account, accept/decline session requests and
communicate with your families
- And much more...


What do we look for in Sylvan In-Home tutors?
At Sylvan, we believe education is everything, great teachers matter, and that a childs future
depends on a solid education and a love of learning. Being a Sylvan tutor means youre part of
the legacy and 40- year reputation of being a trusted, recognized brand that has helped kids
succeed in over 600+ locations worldwide. Thats why we want the best and the brightest, first-
class tutors who share our passion. The ideal Sylvan In-Home candidate has the following
necessary qualifications:
- A Bachelors Degree (preferably one that relates to the type of tutoring youd like to offer)
- Although not required to apply, previous or current state teaching certification is a plus!
- Demonstrated background or experience in the subject you are tutoring
- Successful completion of a phone interview
- Successfully pass a background check

AC2019

job.position: Teacher for summer school
job.description:
Job Description

Overview



Provides contracted instructional services with the necessary educational expertise in reading, mathematics, writing, and related areas; diagnoses learning skill deficits and delivers prescribed instructional delivery methods as determined by the Company; communicates and conferences with parents providing information on student progress.
Teachers can be part time or full time status and are paid a per diem rate.
This is a 2 week summer school program at a nonpublic school in Buffalo NY.



Responsibilities

  • Attends training sessions, passes content assessment, and delivers designated instructional models and strategies in readiness, reading, mathematics, and/or writing skills to eligible students through utilization of?Company materials and educational strategies.
  • Develops and maintains individualized skill-appropriate lesson plans.
  • Ensures supervision of students at all times, including escorting students safely to and from?the classroom or to mobile/trailer classroom.
  • Establishes and maintains student forms and files as required by the Company, local, state, and/or federal agencies.
  • Attends and documents conferences/meetings/trainings with?Company Supervisors, classroom teachers, principals, and parents as required by the Company, local, state, and/or federal agencies.
  • Maintains inventory of educational materials and supplies.


Qualifications



EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE:
Requires a bachelor?s degree and valid teaching certificate, as required by contract. Teaching experience preferred.
LICENSE/CERTIFICATION:

OTHER JOB REQUIREMENTS:
Must understand that all children can learn. Must demonstrate positive and enthusiastic attitude towards internal and external customers. Must be flexible. Working knowledge of Microsoft Office preferred.? Must be available to work during the summer months.
PHYSICAL ENVIRONMENT/WORKING CONDITIONS:
Light lifting, walking, climbing stairs. Most programs are in school settings.
The Company?provides all classroom and instructional materials as well prepared lesson plans and paid training.? Continued instructional and leadership support for all employees is also provided.
Consider this great opportunity to work within your local community.? Help us join forces to better the lives of the students we serve.
Equal Opportunity employer.

#CB2

  • Ensures supervision of students at all times, including escorting students safely to and from?the classroom or to mobile/trailer classroom.
  • Establishes and maintains student forms and files as required by the Company, local, state, and/or federal agencies
  • Maintains educational materials and supplies.


Qualifications



EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE:
Requires a bachelor?s degree and valid teaching certificate, as required by contract. Teaching experience preferred.
LICENSE/CERTIFICATION:

OTHER JOB REQUIREMENTS:
Must understand that all children can learn. Must demonstrate positive and enthusiastic attitude towards internal and external customers. Must be flexible. Working knowledge of Microsoft Office preferred.? Must be available to work during the summer months.
PHYSICAL ENVIRONMENT/WORKING CONDITIONS:
Light lifting, walking, climbing stairs. Most programs are in school settings.
The Company?provides all classroom and instructional materials. Leadership support for all employees is provided.
Consider this great opportunity to work within your local community.? Help us join forces to better the lives of the students we serve.
Equal Opportunity employer.

#CB2

AC2019

job.position: Teacher
job.description:
Description:


KinderCare Education is the nations leader in early childhood education. We nourish curiosity through purposeful experiences to create a future full of lifelong learners. From our National Support Center, to the classrooms where learning comes to life, were united by a passion to create a world of learning, joy and adventure for more than 161,000 children ages six-weeks through 12 years every day.

Our Teachers bring warmth, patience, and understanding to the classroom every day, encouraging children to learn and grow. They inspire children to be lifelong learners using our nationally recognized curriculum that promotes social, physical, verbal, and cognitive development. Our Teachers are committed to making their center successful and know that creating meaningful relationships with children, families, and their team play a crucial role in that success.

When you join our team as a Teacher you will\:

  • Implement KCEs curriculum in a way that is consistent with the unique needs of each child
  • Create a safe, nurturing environment where children can play and learn.
  • Partner and communicate with parents, with a shared desire to provide the best care and education for their children.
  • Support your centers success; partner with center staff and leadership to achieve goals around enrollment, accreditation, and engagement.
  • Cultivate positive relationships with families, teachers, state licensing authorities, community contacts and corporate partners.
Qualification:

Required Skills and Experience\:

  • A love for children and a strong desire to make a difference every day.
  • Ability to build relationships with families and coworkers and create a dynamic environment where play and learning happens.
  • Outstanding customer service skills, strong organizational skills, and the ability to multi-task and manage multiple situations effectively
  • Must possess active Child Development Associate (CDA) Credential and meet NAEYC candidacy requirements (or willing to obtain)
  • CPR and First Aid Certification or willingness to obtain
  • 1+ year Early Childhood Education Experience (preferred)
  • Must meet state specific guidelines for the role
  • Must be physically able to use a computer with basic proficiency, lift a minimum of 40 pounds, and work indoors or outdoors. Must be able to assume postures in low levels to allow physical and visual contact with children, see and hear well enough to keep children safe, and engage in physical activity with children.
  • Ability to speak, read, and write English.

The benefits our career professionals enjoy\:

In addition to a rewarding career where you help shape children's futures, KinderCare Education provides a competitive compensation package. Benefits include\:

  • Medical, dental and vision
  • Discounted child care
  • Generous paid time off
  • Education assistance and reimbursement
  • Medical expense reimbursement/ Life insurance/Disability benefits/ Health and wellness programs
  • 401(k) savings and investment plan with employer match

KinderCare Education employs more than 32,000 team members across 1,700 locations nationwide. Our devoted family of education providers leads the nation in accreditation and includes KinderCare Learning Centers, KinderCare Education at Work, Champions Before- and After-School Programs, Cambridge Schools, Knowledge Beginnings and The Grove School.

KinderCare Education is an Equal Opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, age, sex, religion, disability, sexual orientation, marital status, military or veteran status, gender identity or expression, or any other basis protected by local, state, or federal law.

AC2019

job.position: Teacher
job.description:
Description:


KinderCare Education is the nations leader in early childhood education. We nourish curiosity through purposeful experiences to create a future full of lifelong learners. From our National Support Center, to the classrooms where learning comes to life, were united by a passion to create a world of learning, joy and adventure for more than 161,000 children ages six-weeks through 12 years every day.

Our Teachers bring warmth, patience, and understanding to the classroom every day, encouraging children to learn and grow. They inspire children to be lifelong learners using our nationally recognized curriculum that promotes social, physical, verbal, and cognitive development. Our Teachers are committed to making their center successful and know that creating meaningful relationships with children, families, and their team play a crucial role in that success.

When you join our team as a Teacher you will\:

  • Implement KCEs curriculum in a way that is consistent with the unique needs of each child
  • Create a safe, nurturing environment where children can play and learn.
  • Partner and communicate with parents, with a shared desire to provide the best care and education for their children.
  • Support your centers success; partner with center staff and leadership to achieve goals around enrollment, accreditation, and engagement.
  • Cultivate positive relationships with families, teachers, state licensing authorities, community contacts and corporate partners.
Qualification:

Required Skills and Experience\:

  • A love for children and a strong desire to make a difference every day.
  • Ability to build relationships with families and coworkers and create a dynamic environment where play and learning happens.
  • Outstanding customer service skills, strong organizational skills, and the ability to multi-task and manage multiple situations effectively
  • Must possess active Child Development Associate (CDA) Credential and meet NAEYC candidacy requirements (or willing to obtain)
  • CPR and First Aid Certification or willingness to obtain
  • 1+ year Early Childhood Education Experience (preferred)
  • Must meet state specific guidelines for the role
  • Must be physically able to use a computer with basic proficiency, lift a minimum of 40 pounds, and work indoors or outdoors. Must be able to assume postures in low levels to allow physical and visual contact with children, see and hear well enough to keep children safe, and engage in physical activity with children.
  • Ability to speak, read, and write English.

The benefits our career professionals enjoy\:

In addition to a rewarding career where you help shape children's futures, KinderCare Education provides a competitive compensation package. Benefits include\:

  • Medical, dental and vision
  • Discounted child care
  • Generous paid time off
  • Education assistance and reimbursement
  • Medical expense reimbursement/ Life insurance/Disability benefits/ Health and wellness programs
  • 401(k) savings and investment plan with employer match

KinderCare Education employs more than 32,000 team members across 1,700 locations nationwide. Our devoted family of education providers leads the nation in accreditation and includes KinderCare Learning Centers, KinderCare Education at Work, Champions Before- and After-School Programs, Cambridge Schools, Knowledge Beginnings and The Grove School.

KinderCare Education is an Equal Opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, age, sex, religion, disability, sexual orientation, marital status, military or veteran status, gender identity or expression, or any other basis protected by local, state, or federal law.

AC2019

job.position: Teacher
job.description:
Description:


KinderCare Education is the nations leader in early childhood education. We nourish curiosity through purposeful experiences to create a future full of lifelong learners. From our National Support Center, to the classrooms where learning comes to life, were united by a passion to create a world of learning, joy and adventure for more than 161,000 children ages six-weeks through 12 years every day.

Our Teachers bring warmth, patience, and understanding to the classroom every day, encouraging children to learn and grow. They inspire children to be lifelong learners using our nationally recognized curriculum that promotes social, physical, verbal, and cognitive development. Our Teachers are committed to making their center successful and know that creating meaningful relationships with children, families, and their team play a crucial role in that success.

When you join our team as a Teacher you will\:

  • Implement KCEs curriculum in a way that is consistent with the unique needs of each child
  • Create a safe, nurturing environment where children can play and learn.
  • Partner and communicate with parents, with a shared desire to provide the best care and education for their children.
  • Support your centers success; partner with center staff and leadership to achieve goals around enrollment, accreditation, and engagement.
  • Cultivate positive relationships with families, teachers, state licensing authorities, community contacts and corporate partners.
Qualification:

Required Skills and Experience\:

  • A love for children and a strong desire to make a difference every day.
  • Ability to build relationships with families and coworkers and create a dynamic environment where play and learning happens.
  • Outstanding customer service skills, strong organizational skills, and the ability to multi-task and manage multiple situations effectively
  • Must possess active Child Development Associate (CDA) Credential and meet NAEYC candidacy requirements (or willing to obtain)
  • CPR and First Aid Certification or willingness to obtain
  • 1+ year Early Childhood Education Experience (preferred)
  • Must meet state specific guidelines for the role
  • Must be physically able to use a computer with basic proficiency, lift a minimum of 40 pounds, and work indoors or outdoors. Must be able to assume postures in low levels to allow physical and visual contact with children, see and hear well enough to keep children safe, and engage in physical activity with children.
  • Ability to speak, read, and write English.

The benefits our career professionals enjoy\:

In addition to a rewarding career where you help shape children's futures, KinderCare Education provides a competitive compensation package. Benefits include\:

  • Medical, dental and vision
  • Discounted child care
  • Generous paid time off
  • Education assistance and reimbursement
  • Medical expense reimbursement/ Life insurance/Disability benefits/ Health and wellness programs
  • 401(k) savings and investment plan with employer match

KinderCare Education employs more than 32,000 team members across 1,700 locations nationwide. Our devoted family of education providers leads the nation in accreditation and includes KinderCare Learning Centers, KinderCare Education at Work, Champions Before- and After-School Programs, Cambridge Schools, Knowledge Beginnings and The Grove School.

KinderCare Education is an Equal Opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, age, sex, religion, disability, sexual orientation, marital status, military or veteran status, gender identity or expression, or any other basis protected by local, state, or federal law.

KinderCare Education is the nation?s leader in early childhood education. We nourish curiosity through purposeful experiences to create a future full of lifelong learners.   • Support your center?s success; partner with center staff and leadership to achieve goals around enrollment, accreditation, and engagement.
  • Cultivate positive relationships with families, teachers, state licensing authorities, community contacts and corporate partners.

?
  • A love for children and a strong desire to make a difference every day. ?

AC2019

job.position: Teacher
job.description:
Job Description

Description:

KinderCare Education is the nation?s leader in early childhood education. We nourish curiosity through purposeful experiences to create a future full of lifelong learners. From our National Support Center, to the classrooms where learning comes to life, we?re united by a passion to create a world of learning, joy and adventure for more than 161,000 children ages six-weeks through 12 years every day.
?
Our Teachers bring warmth, patience, and understanding to the classroom every day, encouraging children to learn and grow. They inspire children to be lifelong learners using our nationally recognized curriculum that promotes social, physical, verbal, and cognitive development. Our Teachers are committed to making their center successful and know that creating meaningful relationships with children, families, and their team play a crucial role in that success.
?
When you join our team as a Teacher you will\:
?

  • Implement KCE?s curriculum in a way that is consistent with the unique needs of each child
  • Create a safe, nurturing environment where children can play and learn.
  • Partner and communicate with parents, with a shared desire to provide the best care and education for their children.
  • Support your center?s success; partner with center staff and leadership to achieve goals around enrollment, accreditation, and engagement.
  • Cultivate positive relationships with families, teachers, state licensing authorities, community contacts and corporate partners.
Qualification:
Required Skills and Experience\:

?
  • A love for children and a strong desire to make a difference every day. ?
  • Ability to build relationships with families and coworkers and create a dynamic environment where play and learning happens.
  • Outstanding customer service skills, strong organizational skills, and the ability to multi-task and manage multiple situations effectively
  • Must possess active Child Development Associate (CDA) Credential and meet NAEYC candidacy requirements (or willing to obtain)
  • CPR and First Aid Certification or willingness to obtain
  • 1+ year Early Childhood Education Experience (preferred)
  • Must meet state specific guidelines for the role
  • Must be physically able to use a computer with basic proficiency, lift a minimum of 40 pounds, and work indoors or outdoors. ? Must be able to assume postures in low levels to allow physical and visual contact with children, see and hear well enough to keep children safe, and engage in physical activity with children.
  • Ability to speak, read, and write English.
The benefits our career professionals enjoy\:

?

In addition to a rewarding career where you help shape children's futures, KinderCare Education provides a competitive compensation package. Benefits include\:
  • Medical, dental and vision
  • Discounted child care
  • Generous paid time off
  • Education assistance and reimbursement
  • Medical expense reimbursement/ Life insurance/Disability benefits/ Health and wellness programs
  • 401(k) savings and investment plan with employer match
?

KinderCare Education employs more than 32,000 team members across 1,700 locations nationwide. Our devoted family of education providers leads the nation in accreditation and includes KinderCare? Learning Centers, KinderCare Education at Work?, Champions? Before- and After-School Programs, Cambridge Schools ? , Knowledge Beginnings? and The Grove School?.

?

KinderCare Education is an Equal Opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, age, sex, religion, disability, sexual orientation, marital status, military or veteran status, gender identity or expression, or any other basis protected by local, state, or federal law.

Qualification:
Lead Teacher in an Infant/Toddler program\:

?

Required Skills and Experience\:

A group teacher for an infant/toddler program shall be at least 21 years of age and have the following qualifications\:

(1) Associate's (AA or AS) degree in early childhood education; or

(2) Child Development Associate (CDA) certification and a study plan leading to an associate's degree in early childhood education within seven years; or

(3) High school diploma or equivalent (GED); nine college credits in early childhood education or child development; two years? experience caring for children, and a study plan leading to an associate's degree in early childhood education within seven years; or

(4) High school diploma or equivalent (GED) and five years of supervised experience in an infant/toddler classroom if currently employed in a permitted child care program; or

(5) High school diploma or equivalent (GED); and a study plan that is acceptable to the Department leading to nine credits in early childhood education or childhood development within two years; and a study plan leading to an associate's degree in early childhood education within seven years, if currently employed in a permitted child care program.
  • A love for children and a strong desire to make a difference every day. ?
  • Ability to build relationships with families and coworkers and create a dynamic environment where play and learning happens.
  • Outstanding customer service skills, strong organizational skills, and the ability to multi-task and manage multiple situations effectively
  • Must possess active Child Development Associate (CDA) Credential or meet NAEYC candidacy requirements
  • Approved state trainer (preferred)
  • 2-3 years Early Childhood Education Experience(preferred)
  • Bachelor?s degree in Early Childhood Education (preferred)
  • CPR and First Aid Certification or willingness to obtain
  • Must meet state specific guidelines for the role
  • Must be physically able to use a computer with basic proficiency, lift a minimum of 40 pounds, and work indoors or outdoors.? Must be able to assume postures in low levels to allow physical and visual contact with children, see and hear well enough to keep children safe, and engage in physical activity with children.
  • Ability to speak, read, and write English.

AC2019

job.position: Teacher
job.description:
Job Description

Description:

KinderCare Education is the nation?s leader in early childhood education. We nourish curiosity through purposeful experiences to create a future full of lifelong learners. From our National Support Center, to the classrooms where learning comes to life, we?re united by a passion to create a world of learning, joy and adventure for more than 161,000 children ages six-weeks through 12 years every day.

?

Our Teachers bring warmth, patience, and understanding to the classroom every day, encouraging children to learn and grow. They inspire children to be lifelong learners using our nationally recognized curriculum that promotes social, physical, verbal, and cognitive development. Our Teachers are committed to making their center successful and know that creating meaningful relationships with children, families, and their team play a crucial role in that success.

?

When you join our team as a Lead Teacher you will\:

?
  • Lead, coach and mentor less experienced teachers in your classroom; model behaviors and provide feedback.
  • Implement KCE?s curriculum in a way that is consistent with the unique needs of each child.
  • Create a safe, nurturing environment where children can play and learn.
  • Partner and communicate with parents, with a shared desire to provide the best care and education for their children.
  • Support your center?s success; partner with center staff and leadership to achieve goals around enrollment, accreditation, and engagement.
  • Cultivate positive relationships with families, teachers, state licensing authorities, community contacts and corporate partners.
Qualification:
Required Skills and Experience\:

?
  • A love for children and a strong desire to make a difference every day. ?
  • Ability to build relationships with families and coworkers and create a dynamic environment where play and learning happens.
  • Outstanding customer service skills, strong organizational skills, and the ability to multi-task and manage multiple situations effectively
  • Must possess active Child Development Associate (CDA) Credential or meet NAEYC candidacy requirements
  • Approved state trainer (preferred)
  • 2-3 years Early Childhood Education Experience(preferred)
  • Bachelor?s degree in Early Childhood Education (preferred)
  • CPR and First Aid Certification or willingness to obtain
  • Must meet state specific guidelines for the role
  • Must be physically able to use a computer with basic proficiency, lift a minimum of 40 pounds, and work indoors or outdoors. ? Must be able to assume postures in low levels to allow physical and visual contact with children, see and hear well enough to keep children safe, and engage in physical activity with children.
  • Ability to speak, read, and write English.
The benefits our career professionals enjoy\:

?

In addition to a rewarding career where you help shape children's futures, KinderCare Education provides a competitive compensation package. Benefits include\:

?
  • Medical, dental and vision
  • Discounted child care
  • Generous paid time off
  • Education assistance and reimbursement
  • Medical expense reimbursement/ Life insurance/Disability benefits/ Health and wellness programs
  • 401(k) savings and investment plan with employer match
?
